column4: can anyone help me with a virtualbox error. error saids VirtualBox cant operate in VMX root mode.Please disable the kvm kernel extension, recompile your kernel and reboot.
do you have kvm installed?  especially the kernel acceleration part (i forgot what it's called)?
I install kvm dont know what kernel acceleration to install.

can you uninstall kvm?  might be the easiest, you'll might have to run "sudo apt-get auto-remove" (only do if prompted after kvm removal to remove anything else it may have installed), obviously if you need both then you have an issue.
when you removed kvm did it say certain packages where no longer needed?  have you rebooted the system?

if it's a kernel module that's loaded, it might still be loaded even though you've uninstalled kvm (which i'm unsure if it uninstalled the kvm kernel stuff!), but rebooted would clear that stuff up - so i'd try it (it would be possible to do without rebooting if we knew the module name that kvm loads)
i dont know if this helps (VERR_VMX_IN_VMX_ROOT_MODE) it also has that in the error
doesn't help me i'm affraid - i haven't used kvm in a million years, i only use vbox now (& vmware for school) - but this kvm/vbox issue has been around for a long time!
is there another type i can use that is more useful less errors

your current issue is due to having too many installed at one time, i doubt adding more would help ;)  vbox is GREAT for me, but VMware is good as well.  i don't like kvm/qemu nearly as much, but it's all personal preferences/needs.
ok so ill uninstall everything dealing with vbox
i think vbox is the one you should use ;)  it's all up to you.
Vbox is same as virtualbox right?
